A treatise of japaning and varnishing being a compleat discovery of those arts : with the best way of making all sorts of varnish ... : together with above an hundred distinct patterns of japan-work ... : curiously engraven on 24 large copper plates / by John Stalker. Stalker, John. Parker, George, 17th cent.
[8], 84 p., [24] leaves of plates.
Printed for, and sold by the author ..., Oxford : in the year MDCLXXXVIII. [1688]
Attributed to John Stalker and George Parker. Cf. BM. Table of Contents: p. [8] at front. Item at reel 893:21 identified as Wing P390 (number cancelled). Reproductions of originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and Bodleian Library.
=======

Stalker, John. Parker, George, 17th cent.
[8], 84 p., [24] leaves of plates.
Printed for, and sold by the author ..., Oxford : in the year MDCLXXXVIII. [1688]
Attributed to John Stalker and George Parker. Cf. BM. Table of Contents: p. [8] at front. Item at reel 893:21 identified as Wing P390 (number cancelled). Reproductions of originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and Bodleian Library.
